item.title: Materialia Lumina: Contemporary Artists' Books from the Codex International Book Fair at Green Library, Bing Wing
item.description:
Stanford Libraries presents Materialia Lumina: Contemporary Artists' Books from the Codex International Book Fair, on view February 24, 2022, through August 28, 2022, in the Peterson Gallery and Munger Rotunda, Cecil H. Green Library Bing Wing, 2nd Floor.

The exhibition Materialia Lumina is curated by Robert Trujillo; produced, designed, and installed by Deardra Fuzzell. 

NOTE: Exhibit cases in the Peterson Gallery and Munger Rotunda are illuminated from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. Visitors are encouraged to call 650-723-0931 or visit the Library Hours page to confirm hours and access.

The exhibition is free and currently restricted to the following current Stanford ID cardholders: students, post-docs, professors (including emeriti), academic staff, fellows, and Stanford visiting scholars. Learn about the Libraries' entry requirements and available services.

item.title: Tabletop Tuesdays: Unpacking Nationalism in War Games at Green Library, East Wing
item.description: Tabletop Tuesdays is a new event series held on the third Tuesday of each month. At these events, we'll feature a selection of board games and collection items from across SUL's holdings around a specific theme. Drop in to learn about the month's featured game(s) and/or try some of the board games we have for open play at the Silicon Valley Archives.

item.title: Justice, Equity, Diversity, and Inclusion (JEDI) Fair at Green Library, Bing Wing
item.description:
Stanford Libraries is hosting its 2nd annual Justice, Equity, Diversity, and Inclusion (JEDI) Fair to highlight social justice projects, collections, and efforts happening within the Libraries and at other departments across the Stanford campus.   
 
Hear featured speakers, see live demonstrations of the Know Systemic Racism (KSR) database and highlights from the Libraries existing social justice collections, attend a new book release and signing by co-authors Stephen Shames and Ericka Huggins, and pick up lots of great giveaways.

Following the Fair, starting at 4:30 pm in Green Library's Hohbach Hall presentation room, join co-authors Stephen Shames and Ericka Huggins of the newly released book, Comrade Sisters: Women of the Black Panther Party, and other former Black Panther Party members for a panel discussion. Book sales and signing will follow outside of Green Library on the patio nearest Coupa Café.

Come expecting to leave empowered!

Check back for updates


.
